intro: Audibertia dorrii, commonly known as the Dorrii's goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in well-drained soils. Audibertia dorrii is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
